definition[0]: someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc
definition[1]: to fail after a period of time because something has gone wrong
example[0]: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
example[1]: The talks foundered on disagreements between the two parties.
definition[2]: if a ship or boat founders, it fills with water and sinks
example[2]: The ship foundered on the rocks.
definition[3]: a person who starts a new company or organization
example[3]: The companyâ€™s founder and chairman, Charles Munch, has resigned.
definition[4]: if a company, plan, job etc founders, it fails or is unsuccessful
example[4]: Two major companies foundered this week.
example[5]: A potential rescue deal foundered after they rebuffed an offer of $2.5 million.
example[6]: The institution foundered on huge loan losses.
